revised_title: Physics and Applications of Thermotropic Liquid Crystals: Continuum Theory of Nematics
tldr: This article presents a concise derivation of the continuum equations used to describe static and dynamic phenomena in nematic liquid crystals. It focuses on the mechanical behavior of thermotropic liquid crystals and assesses the progress in measuring their material parameters. The author discusses the static and dynamic theories, the energy balance, and the conservation of linear and angular momenta in nematic liquid crystals. The article also highlights the importance of understanding the material parameters and their impact on the behavior of liquid crystals.
